summary: Completed backend testing of Auto-Apply features and Resume management. All 17 tests passed (100%). Verified all 3 fixes from the main agent: 1) run_auto_apply uses 'resume_content' variable correctly, 2) update_auto_apply_settings filters out ObjectId, 3) tax_types (plural) used consistently.
passed_tests: API Health Check - returns healthy status (200)
Set Primary Resume - returns 404 for non-existent resume
Set Primary Resume - gets list of resumes (200)
Set Primary Resume - successfully sets resume as primary and verifies persistence
Profile Tax Types - updates with multiple tax types (Fulltime, C2C, W2 Contract)
Profile Tax Types - updates with single tax type
Profile Tax Types - updates with empty tax types array
Auto-Apply Settings - gets settings without ObjectId (200)
Auto-Apply Settings - updates basic settings without ObjectId error
Auto-Apply Settings - updates settings with resume_id without ObjectId error
Auto-Apply Settings - verifies settings persistence correctly
Auto-Apply Run - requires settings to be configured (400)
Auto-Apply Run - successfully runs with valid settings and processes jobs
Auto-Apply History - returns history without ObjectId in records
Live Jobs Search - returns jobs from internal scraper (200)
critical_code_review_comments: All 3 fixes verified in code: resume_content variable (line 3802), ObjectId filter (line 3557), tax_types plural usage
Auto-apply successfully scraped jobs from Dice and RemoteOK (JSearch API rate limited as expected)
seed_data_creation: Used existing test user, auto-apply created 5 job applications during testing
mocked_api_note: None - all real integrations. JSearch API returns 429 (rate limited) so auto-apply relies on fallback scrapers (Dice, RemoteOK) which work correctly.
context_for_next_testing_agent: Auto-apply features fully tested. All endpoints working: /api/auto-apply/settings (GET/POST), /api/auto-apply/run (POST), /api/auto-apply/history (GET), /api/resumes/{id}/set-primary (PUT), /api/auth/profile (PUT for tax_types). The internal job scraper successfully finds jobs from Dice and RemoteOK when JSearch is rate limited.
